definition: see 磅秤 scale/platform balance/(loanword) pound (unit of weight, about 454 grams)

sentences.english: Let life shine with a smile, for the life of a surging tide night.
sentences.chinese: 让生活绽放一次笑容，让生命磅礴一次潮夕。

sentences.english: The tremendous momentum of the Yellow River is inspiring.
sentences.chinese: 黄河的磅礴气势使人振奋。

sentences.english: And nothing really can compare with the splendorous scene of sunrise and sunset here.
sentences.chinese: 那早晚日出日落的磅礴景象，更是这边独好。

sentences.english: The theme song of Xiamen TV , 2008. It's very magnificent and heart-stirring .
sentences.chinese: 2008年厦门卫视主题曲，大气磅礴，励志动听。

sentences.english: Hill of Yang 's two, steep mountains, of great momentum.
sentences.chinese: 山之阳的两路，山势陡峭，气势磅礴。

sentences.english: Clusters of 20 to 30-storey buildings are magnificent and pleasing.
sentences.chinese: 一簇簇二三十层的楼群气势磅礴，赏心悦目。

sentences.english: On the blue surface of thine aery surge.
sentences.chinese: 在你的磅礴之气的蔚蓝的波面。

sentences.english: Located at Beijing west, within the boundaries mountain high mountains are rolling, with overpowering momentum.
sentences.chinese: 位于北京西部，境内高山峻岭连绵起伏，气势磅礴。

definition: vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
